metadata.Title: CVE-2016-1570 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low.
metadata.Description:
The PV superpage functionality in arch/x86/mm.c in Xen 3.4.0, 3.4.1, and 4.1.x through 4.6.x allows local PV guests to obtain sensitive information, cause a denial of service, gain privileges, or have unspecified other impact via a crafted page identifier (MFN) to the (1) MMUEXT_MARK_SUPER or (2) MMUEXT_UNMARK_SUPER sub-op in the HYPERVISOR_mmuext_op hypercall or (3) unknown vectors related to page table updates.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-1570` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libxen-4.4 - 4.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.5
libxen-ocaml - 4.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.5
libxenstore3.0 - 4.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.5
xen-hypervisor-4.1-amd64 - 4.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.5
xen-hypervisor-4.3-amd64 - 4.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.5
xen-hypervisor-4.3-armhf - 4.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.5
xen-hypervisor-4.4-amd64 - 4.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.5
xen-hypervisor-4.4-arm64 - 4.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.5
xen-hypervisor-4.4-armhf - 4.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.5
